text: They can never take these memories away from us
author: KaiserKiller

text: but I have to say that minecraft city is epic but it’s more epic with the moog city song
author: war god 1944 MC

text: 0:14 awwwww man that city is a hundred times better then my minecraft city
author: war god 1944 MC

text: C418 really has incredible talent and promise as a composer. I mean just listen to how well he put every sound together from 1:31 to 2:01! It's on par with renowned modern composers such as Hanz Zimmer and John Williams if you ask me. The way he combines and utilizes each sound together is genius. And this was at the beginning of his career.
author: Okabe Lintahlo

text: My picture I get from this song is a city that represents something between star wars and tron. Glowing night lights, hovercraft flying through the air, and this song sort of represents what it would be like to live outside of the futuristic city and then suddenly experiencing it for the first time.
author: Okabe Lintahlo

text: Minecraft- Sim City Edition

text: Another great pick. I am loving the recent ambient track uploads, especially this one and Ecco.
author: Maxadude

text: Moog city played in Minecraft? I thought it was just in the C418 album.
author: TheDolphinTuna

text: Another Minecraft upload, another awesome track. I love the synths in this one, they give a nice futuristic city vibe along with the always solid piano, the game's main instrument. I was a big Lego fan as a kid since I always liked to build things, I can't even imagine how much I'd have liked this game back then when I had way too much free time on my hands.
author: SupraDarky

text: I second that statement Gabe.  I loved Legos growing up and this game would have been a smash hit back then.  I love Minecraft.  Its soundtrack is one of the best ambient soundtracks i have ever listened to.  I need to get back to playing this game again.
author: Eric C.

text: The music from Minecraft Beta might be some of the best music I've heard in my life. Sadly it only plays during creative mode...

text: If you havent already you should check out the game Starbound. Its like terraria but in space. The music is really good.
